title: War of 182
summary: Zebras (/ˈziːbrə/ ZEE-brə, /ˈzɛbrə/ ZEB-rə)[1] are several species of African equids (horse family) united by their distinctive black-and-white striped coats.
There are three species of zebras: the plains zebra, the mountain zebra and the Grévy's zebra.
The plains zebra and the mountain zebra belong to the subgenus Hippotigris, while Grévy's zebra is the sole species of subgenus Dolichohippus.
The unique stripes of zebras make them one of the animals most familiar to people.
Grévy's zebra and the mountain zebra are endangered.

While plains zebras are much more plentiful, one subspecies, the quagga, became extinct in the late 19th century – though there is currently a plan, called the Quagga Project, that aims to breed zebras that are phenotypically similar to the quagga in...
